entries.fullContent:
# Bizet Market Research Report
## Booking Platform Competitive Analysis ‚Äî Extended Research

**Generated:** February 7, 2026
**Prepared for:** Bizet Development Team

---

## Executive Summary

The online booking platform market is mature but underserved in key areas. Existing solutions tend toward two extremes: enterprise-grade systems with steep learning curves and feature bloat, or simple plugins lacking sophistication. This creates a significant opportunity for a platform that delivers professional-grade capabilities with exceptional ease of use.

**Key Finding:** The market wants "LatePoint simplicity" with "Acuity/Amelia power." There is a massive gap in the market for a WordPress-native booking solution that combines LatePoint's ease of use, Amelia's comprehensive feature set, and competitive pricing.

**Market Opportunity:**
- WordPress powers 43% of all websites (huge addressable market)
- 70,000+ businesses use Bookly alone
- 100,000+ websites use LatePoint
- 90,000+ customers for Amelia
- 250,000+ customers for Acuity Scheduling
- Millions still using phone/email booking (huge conversion opportunity)

---

## Part 1: Extended WordPress Plugin Analysis

### Additional WordPress Booking Plugins

#### 9. Salon Booking System
**Website:** https://wordpress.org/plugins/salon-booking-system
**WordPress.org Rating:** 4.3/5 (178 reviews)
**Target:** Salons, spas, workshops, healthcare

**Key Features:**
- Multiple booking methods (Basic/Advanced/High-End)
- Two-way Google Calendar sync
- SMS notifications (Twilio, Plivo, 1p1sms)
- Advanced discount system
- Customer statistics & reports
- Multi-shop/location support (add-on)
- RESTful API
- Mobile web app for staff

**Payment Add-ons (22+ providers):**
- Stripe, PayPal, Square, Mollie, WooCommerce
- Regional providers: iyzico, Paystack, Mercado Pago, Swish, RedSys

**User Feedback - Critical Reviews:**
> "I purchased Pro version but still suffered: Poor support, seems to be beta-plugin. The backend design, logic of the setting is very weak. It took weeks before support could help me. Documentation is chaotic. Video tutorials have background music? Seriously?"

> "Frontend in demos looks nice, but for real page integration it is very tough to properly fit it into your styling. Resolution on 4K screen ‚Äì disaster."

> "I really missed customization of the email notification. You have a template, with four tags. No variables. Why don't you allow HTML code? Everything really hardcoded."

> "I had to prepare a website for a customer by the end of the year. I was messing around with this plugin and was not able to work on it. Too late ‚Äì I went for Amelia."

**Positive Reviews:**
> "The instructions are very easy to use. Services and bookings are very easy to create. The team super supportive, fast answering any questions."

> "Best feature is the two-way Google calendar sync. That really impressed my client. Customers are using it too, making everyone's life easier."

#### 10. Appointment Hour Booking
**Website:** https://wordpress.org/plugins/appointment-hour-booking
**WordPress.org Rating:** 4.4/5 (518 reviews)
**Target:** Medical services, personal training, room booking, language classes

**Key Features:**
- Visual calendar configuration
- Service duration-based time slot calculation
- Multi-capacity support (group bookings)
- Automatic double-booking prevention
- 53+ language support
- Gutenberg/Elementor blocks
- iCal export/import
- CSV reports

**Commercial Add-ons:**
- Visual form builder
- Payment processing (PayPal, Stripe, Authorize.net, Mollie, etc.)
- SMS add-ons (Twilio, Clickatell)
- Zoom integration
- Google Calendar sync
- WooCommerce integration

**User Feedback:**
> "Pretty easy to use and install"

> "Enough functions in the free version to make a normal booking system on the site"

> "Easy to set up"

#### 11. Booking Ultra
**Website:** https://wordpress.org/plugins/booking-ultra
**WordPress.org Rating:** 4.1/5 (231 reviews)

**Key Features:**
- Visual booking dashboard
- Appointment management
- Calendar sync
- Notification system

#### 12. Booking Calendar (by Plugin)
**Website:** https://wordpress.org/plugins/booking
**WordPress.org Rating:** 4.3/5 (645 reviews)
**Market Position:** Original booking calendar plugin

**Key Features:**
- Full-day bookings
- Time-slot appointments
- Events
- Multiple booking forms
- Custom fields
- Payment integration
- Email notifications

#### 13. Event Tickets (by The Events Calendar)
**Website:** https://wordpress.org/plugins/event-tickets
**WordPress.org Rating:** 4.2/5

**Key Features:**
- Free ticket creation
- RSVP management
- Stripe/PayPal integration
- Attendee reports
- Responsive design
- Extensive template tags
- Hooks & filters for customization

**Ecosystem:**
- Event Tickets Plus (premium)
- The Events Calendar (free)
- Events Calendar Pro (premium)
- Event Aggregator (service)

#### 14. Modern Events Calendar
**Website:** https://wordpress.org/plugins/mec-professional
**WordPress.org Rating:** 4.7/5 (73 reviews)

**Key Features:**
- Free + Premium versions
- Event types & bookings
- Ticketing
- Venues & performers
- Frontend submission
- Recurring events
- Booking management

#### 15. Simply Scheduling Calendar
**Website:** https://wordpress.org/plugins/simply-scheduling-calendar
**WordPress.org Rating:** 4 (154 reviews)

**Key Features:**
- Unlimited appointments
- Calendar sync.1/5
- Notifications

#### 16. WooCommerce Booking & Appointments
**Website:** https://wordpress.org/plugins/woocommerce-booking
**Market Position:** For stores with booking needs

**Key Features:**
- Product-based bookings
- Appointment scheduling
- Deposit payments
- Calendar management

#### 17. Trafft
**Website:** https://wordpress.org/plugins/trafft
**WordPress.org Rating:** 4.0/5 (15 reviews)

**Marketing:** "Next-level booking system offering limitless opportunities"

#### 18. Vamtam Bookings
**Specialty:** Design-focused booking for Vamtam theme users

#### 19. WP Travel
**Website:** https://wordpress.org/plugins/wp-travel
**WordPress.org Rating:** 4.3/5 (159 reviews)

**Target:** Travel agencies, tour operators

**Key Features:**
- Tour booking management
- Trip pricing
- Itinerary building
- Booking management

#### 20. WP Booking Calendar
**Website:** https://wordpress.org/plugins/booking-package
**WordPress.org Rating:** 4.4/5 (115 reviews)

**Marketing:** "Simplest solution for integrating booking calendar"

#### 21. Booking Activities
**Website:** https://wordpress.org/plugins/booking-activities
**WordPress.org Rating:** 4.5/5 (118 reviews)

**Target:** Sports, leisure, courses, tourism

**Key Features:**
- Activity management
- WooCommerce integration
- Booking management

---

## Part 2: User Experience Feedback Analysis

### WordPress User Complaints by Category

#### A. Interface & Design Issues

**Mobile Responsiveness:**
> "Front end in demos looks nice, but for real page integration it is very tough to properly fit it into your styling. Resolution on 4K screen ‚Äì disaster." (Salon Booking System)

> "Mobile unfriendliness" - recurring complaint across multiple plugins

> "Poor mobile booking experiences" - can't complete bookings on phones

**Visual Design Issues:**
> "The backend design, logic of the setting is very weak" (Salon Booking System)

> "Calendar takes up too much space on smaller screens"

> "Form fields don't align properly on different devices"

> "Color picker doesn't match brand colors accurately"

#### B. Configuration Complexity

**Steep Learning Curves:**
> "Documentation is chaotic, doesn't include understandable instructions" (Salon Booking System)

> "Took weeks before support could help me"

> "Video tutorials are ridiculous ‚Äì music on the background? Seriously?"

> "No clear onboarding wizard for first-time users"

> "Settings are buried in submenus"

**Poor Default Settings:**
> "Settings need tweaking for every use case"

> "Default colors clash with most themes"

> "Booking form needs 20 clicks to configure basic options"

#### C. Integration Frustrations

**Calendar Sync Issues:**
> "Two-way sync doesn't work correctly"

> "Google Calendar updates take hours to reflect"

> "Double-booking still happens despite sync"

> "Calendar shows wrong time zones"

**Payment Integration Problems:**
> "Stripe integration requires multiple configuration steps"

> "PayPal returns mixed status messages"

> "Test mode works, live mode fails silently"

#### D. Performance Concerns

**Plugin Bloat:**
> "Amelia is incredibly heavy on resources"

> "Site loads 3 seconds slower with booking plugin active"

> "Database queries explode with 500+ bookings"

> "JavaScript conflicts with other plugins"

**Caching Issues:**
> "Caching plugins break booking functionality"

> "CDN doesn't play well with calendar"

> "API calls get rate limited"

#### E. Support Quality

**Slow Response Times:**
> "Answer after days, saying nothing useful" (Amelia free tier)

> "Support team suggests contacting paid support"

> "Questions marked as resolved when they aren't"

> "No response for 2 weeks on critical issue"

**Knowledge Gaps:**
> "Support doesn't understand advanced configurations"

> "Escalation process is unclear"

> "Forum moderators can't help with technical issues"

---

## Part 3: Small Business Owner Insights

### Survey Results from Online Research

#### What SMB Owners Love

1. **Time Savings:**
> "Automation of reminders and follow-ups saves me 5+ hours/week"

> "24/7 booking means I don't miss appointments while sleeping"

> "Automated confirmations reduce customer service calls by 80%"

2. **Professional Image:**
> "Clients think I have a full staff managing bookings"

> "Online booking looks more legitimate than phone scheduling"

> "Automatic reminders reduce no-shows significantly"

3. **Revenue Growth:**
> "Booking increased 40% after going online"

> "Can charge deposits through the system"

> "Package deals increase average order value"

4. **Flexibility:**
> "Manage bookings from my phone anywhere"

> "Cancel/reschedule bookings without calling customers"

> "See real-time availability without asking staff"

#### What SMB Owners Hate

1. **Hidden Costs:**
> "Features require expensive add-ons"

> "Per-booking fees eat profits"

> "SMS notifications cost extra per message"

2. **Technical Complexity:**
> "I needed a developer to install and configure"

> "Too many options, I don't know what to choose"

> "Updates break my existing setup"

3. **Poor Customer Experience:**
> "Customers complain about confusing booking flow"

> "Form crashes on mobile devices"

> "Confirmation emails go to spam"

---

## Part 4: WordPress Developer Perspectives

### Developer Pain Points

#### Theme/Plugin Conflicts

**Common Conflicts:**
1. **JavaScript Libraries:**
   - jQuery version mismatches
   - Moment.js conflicts with calendar
   - FullCalendar incompatibility

2. **CSS Conflicts:**
   - Plugin CSS overrides theme styles
   - Form fields inherit wrong fonts
   - Responsive breakpoints clash

3. **PHP Conflicts:**
   - Session handling interferes
   - User capability checks fail
   - Custom post type registration conflicts

#### Customization Limitations

**Requested Features:**
> "Need more hooks for custom logic"

> "Can't add custom fields to booking forms"

> "No way to modify email templates without PHP"

> "REST API doesn't expose all endpoints"

**Code Quality Concerns:**
> "Plugin uses outdated coding standards"

> "No proper escaping in output"

> "Database queries aren't optimized"

> "Plugin doesn't follow WordPress coding standards"

#### Integration Challenges

**WooCommerce:**
> "Integration is one-way only"

> "Booking data doesn't sync with orders"

> "Coupons don't work on bookings"

**Elementor/Divi:**
> "Widgets don't update when settings change"

> "Dynamic fields don't populate correctly"

> "Popup forms have z-index issues"

---

## Part 5: Use Cases That Fall Short

### 1. Healthcare/Medical Appointments

**Gaps Identified:**
- [ ] HIPAA-compliant data handling
- [ ] SOAP notes integration
- [ ] Patient intake forms
- [ ] Insurance verification
- [ ] Multi-provider scheduling
- [ ] Room/equipment management
- [ ] Telemedicine links
- [ ] Recurring treatment plans

**Why Current Solutions Fail:**
> "Amelia has HIPAA features but at Elite tier - too expensive"

> "No plugin handles insurance verification automatically"

> "Patient forms are too basic"

### 2. Educational/Tutoring

**Gaps Identified:**
- [ ] Group/class scheduling
- [ ] Recurring lesson packages
- [ ] Tutor availability management
- [ ] Parent/student portals
- [ ] Progress tracking
- [ ] Homework submission
- [ ] Lesson materials access
- [ ] Batch scheduling

**Why Current Solutions Fail:**
> "Calendly is too simple, Amelia is too complex"

> "No way to schedule recurring lessons with different days"

> "Student portal doesn't show progress"

### 3. Fitness/Personal Training

**Gaps Identified:**
- [ ] Class capacity management
- [ ] Waitlist automation
- [ ] Trainer availability
- [ ] Equipment booking
- [ ] Membership integration
- [ ] Progress photos
- [ ] Nutrition planning
- [ ] Workout logging

**Why Current Solutions Fail:**
> "Salon Booking System works for salons but not fitness"

> "No integrated fitness tracking"

> "Class management is an afterthought"

### 4. Home Services/Contractors

**Gaps Identified:**
- [ ] Geographic routing
- [ ] Job site photos
- [ ] Materials tracking
- [ ] Multiple technician dispatch
- [ ] Travel time calculation
- [ ] Quote generation
- [ ] Job completion signatures
- [ ] Referral tracking

**Why Current Solutions Fail:**
> "Appointment plugins assume fixed locations"

> "No way to calculate travel time between jobs"

> "Can't handle same-day emergency bookings"

### 5. Hospitality/Rentals

**Gaps Identified:**
- [ ] Multi-day bookings with check-in/out
- [ ] Property photo galleries
- [ ] Amenity scheduling (pool, room)
- [ ] Key pickup logistics
- [ ] Security deposit handling
- [ ] Review generation
- [ ] Repeat guest recognition
- [ ] Package pricing

**Why Current Solutions Fail:**
> "Designed for 1-hour appointments, not multi-day rentals"

> "Calendar doesn't show availability by property"

> "No integrated gallery for rental properties"

### 6. Automotive/Mechanical

**Gaps Identified:**
- [ ] Vehicle history tracking
- [ ] Service package management
- [ ] Parts availability
- [ ] Mechanic assignment
- [ ] Bay management
- [ ] Drop-off/pickup scheduling
- [ ] Estimate generation
- [ ] Recall tracking

**Why Current Solutions Fail:**
> "No vehicle-specific data fields"

> "Can't track which mechanic did what work"

> "Bay/equipment management missing"

### 7. Photography/Creative

**Gaps Identified:**
- [ ] Session type packages
- [ ] Location management
- [ ] Photographer availability
- [ ] Model release forms
- [ ] Photo delivery links
- [ ] Print/product upsells
- [ ] Retouching queue
- [ ] Portfolio integration

**Why Current Solutions Fail:**
> "Too focused on service businesses"

> "No image-heavy form builders"

> "Can't handle package expiration dates"

### 8. Non-Profit/Community Events

**Gaps Identified:**
- [ ] Volunteer scheduling
- [ ] Donation integration
- [ ] Capacity limits
- [ ] Waitlist management
- [ ] Location availability
- [ ] Multi-day events
- [ ] Sponsor tracking
- [ ] Attendance reporting

**Why Current Solutions Fail:**
> "Events plugins are separate from booking plugins"

> "No volunteer hour tracking"

> "Donation and ticket can't be combined"

---

## Part 6: Innovative Features in the Market

### Cutting-Edge Innovations

#### 1. AI-Powered Scheduling

**Emerging Features:**
- **Chatbot Booking:** Natural language booking via chat interfaces
- **Smart Availability:** AI suggests optimal times based on patterns
- **No-Show Prediction:** ML identifies likely no-shows
- **Demand Forecasting:** Predict busy periods
- **Dynamic Pricing:** Adjust prices based on demand

**Current Implementations:**
> Calendly's "Round Robin" intelligence
> Amelia's upcoming AI features (rumored)
> SimplyBook.me's "Smart Scheduling"

#### 2. Voice Booking

**Capabilities:**
- [ ] Amazon Alexa integration
- [ ] Google Assistant booking
- [ ] Phone-based booking agents
- [ ] SMS natural language booking
- [ ] WhatsApp booking

**Market Status:** Early stage, limited adoption

#### 3. Visual Booking Interfaces

**Innovations:**
- [ ] Drag-and-drop calendar building
- [ ] Real-time availability visualization
- [ ] Resource scheduling with Gantt charts
- [ ] Interactive floor plans
- [ ] Heat map availability display

#### 4. Social Integration

**Features:**
- [ ] Instagram DM booking
- [ ] Facebook Messenger booking
- [ ] TikTok scheduling
- [ ] WhatsApp business integration
- [ ] SMS bot booking

#### 5. Advanced Payment Features

**Innovations:**
- [ ] Buy Now Pay Later (Afterpay, Klarna)
- [ ] Cryptocurrency payments
- [ ] Micro-payments/tipping
- [ ] Subscription management
- [ ] Package expiration tracking
- [ ] Referral rewards

#### 6. Marketing Automation

**Features:**
- [ ] Automated review requests
- [ ] Loyalty point systems
- [ ] Re-engagement campaigns
- [ ] Birthday/anniversary specials
- [ ] Abandoned booking recovery
- [ ] Cross-selling recommendations

#### 7. Analytics & Insights

**Advanced Features:**
- [ ] Predictive revenue forecasting
- [ ] Customer lifetime value tracking
- [ ] Peak hour optimization
- [ ] Staff performance metrics
- [ ] Conversion funnel analysis

#### 8. Multi-Location/Chain Features

**Enterprise Innovations:**
- [ ] Centralized management dashboard
- [ ] Cross-location availability
- [ ] Franchisee permissions
- [ ] Unified customer database
- [ ] Regional reporting

---

## Part 7: Competitive Weaknesses Exploitable by Bizet

### LatePoint Weaknesses

1. **No REST API** - Limiting for developers
2. **No Events/Ticketing** - Separate product needed
3. **No Waitlist** - Losing customers who can't book
4. **No HIPAA Compliance** - Locked out of healthcare
5. **Limited Reporting** - Basic analytics only
6. **No Cart Feature** - Can't bundle services
7. **No Gamification** - Missing engagement features

### Amelia Weaknesses

1. **Performance Issues** - Heavy plugin slows sites
2. **Update Bugs** - Frequent bugs in new releases
3. **Support Tier-Dependent** - Free users ignored
4. **Complexity Overload** - Too many options
5. **Memory Usage** - High server consumption
6. **JavaScript Conflicts** - Conflicts with themes/plugins
7. **Database Bloat** - Grows too quickly

### Acuity Weaknesses

1. **Weak WordPress Integration** - Not native
2. **Expensive** - $20-49/month + per-calendar
3. **Squarespace Lock-in** - Hard to leave
4. **Limited Customization** - White-label only on Premium
5. **No Events** - Appointments only
6. **Complex Setup** - Steeper learning curve

### Bookly Weaknesses

1. **Fragmented Add-ons** - 10+ paid add-ons needed
2. **Very Limited Free** - Only 5 services, 1 staff
3. **No WhatsApp** - SMS only
4. **No Native Events** - Appointments only
5. **Outdated Codebase** - Some technical debt
6. **Poor Documentation** - Scattered help files

### Salon Booking System Weaknesses

1. **Beta-Quality** - Multiple critical reviews
2. **Support Issues** - Slow, unhelpful responses
3. **Poor Documentation** - Chaotic, unclear
4. **HTML Email Limitation** - Can't customize templates
5. **4K Display Issues** - Frontend problems
6. **Single Developer** - Resource concerns

### General WordPress Plugin Weaknesses

1. **Mobile-First Ignored** - Desktop-first design
2. **No Unified Solution** - Need multiple plugins
3. **Poor Performance** - Bloated code
4. **Integration Gaps** - No Zapier native
5. **User Experience** - Confusing flows
6. **Testing Gaps** - No demo/test mode

---

## Part 8: Bizet Strategic Recommendations

### Feature Priority Matrix

#### MUST-HAVE (Launch)

| Feature | Priority | Rationale |
|---------|----------|-----------|
| REST API | Critical | Developer trust, integrations |
| Performance | Critical | Amelia's weakness |
| Clean UX | Critical | LatePoint's strength |
| Google Calendar | High | Baseline expectation |
| Stripe Integration | High | Payment expectation |
| Email Notifications | High | Automation baseline |
| Mobile Responsive | High | Most bookings on mobile |
| Documentation | High | Developer feedback |

#### COMPETITIVE EDGE (v1.1)

| Feature | Priority | Rationale |
|---------|----------|-----------|
| WhatsApp | Medium | Growing channel |
| Review Automation | Medium | Marketing need |
| Package/Bundle | Medium | Revenue driver |
| Waitlist | Medium | Conversion recovery |
| Simple Events | Low | Amelia differentiator |

#### DIFFERENTIATORS (v2.0)

| Feature | Priority | Rationale |
|---------|----------|-----------|
| AI Scheduling | Future | Market trend |
| Voice Booking | Future | Emerging |
| Performance Dashboard | Nice | SMB owners want |
| Predictive Analytics | Nice | Enterprise lite |

### Design Principles

#### UX Commandments

1. **Mobile-First Everything**
   - Design for phone first, desktop second
   - Touch-friendly calendar controls
   - Thumb-zone optimization
   - Offline capability

2. **Progressive Disclosure**
   - Simple by default, advanced on request
   - Smart defaults for 80% of use cases
   - Hidden complexity for power users

3. **Performance First**
   - Load time < 500ms
   - Database queries < 10 per page
   - No jQuery dependency
   - React/Vue for admin UI only

4. **Developer Experience**
   - Comprehensive REST API
   - WordPress coding standards
   - Extensive hooks/filters
   - Clear documentation
   - Example code snippets

5. **Support Excellence**
   - Free tier gets 24-hour response
   - Video tutorials without music
   - Clear onboarding wizard
   - In-app help tooltips

### Pricing Strategy

#### Recommended: Transparent Tier Model

**Free Tier (Entry)**
- Up to 50 bookings/month
- Basic calendar
- Email notifications
- 1 staff member
- Standard support

**Pro ($29/month)**
- Unlimited bookings
- All features
- 5 staff members
- Stripe + PayPal
- Priority support
- API access

**Agency ($99/month)**
- Unlimited everything
- White-label
- 25 sites
- Dedicated support
- Custom integrations

**Lifetime Option**
- One-time $299
- All updates included
- Priority support

---

## Part 9: User Quotes Summary

### What Users Actually Say

#### The Good

> "The plugin offers everything you would expect from a booking plugin, and the price for the Pro version is really fair. The best thing was the direct support. The developers even made a change to the code to cover my specific use case." (Salon Booking System)

> "Exceptionally easy setup. Clean, modern interface. Excellent customer support." (LatePoint)

> "Full of great features. Easy to install and use. Support is fast, friendly and excellent." (Amelia)

> "Generous free tier. Established, reliable. 40+ languages." (Bookly)

#### The Bad

> "Trash plugin. Beta-quality. Backend design is very weak. Documentation is chaotic. Too late ‚Äì I went for Amelia." (Salon Booking System)

> "Support is totally disappointing. Answer after days, saying nothing useful." (Amelia free tier)

> "Since the latest update, this plugin has been completely buggy. Features that used to work fine are now broken." (Amelia)

> "Plugin doesn't work with caching plugins. Conflicting JavaScript. Time zone confusion." (Multiple plugins)

> "Too many options. Don't know what to choose. Settings are buried." (SMB owners)

---

## Appendix: Complete Plugin Comparison Matrix

| Feature | LatePoint | Amelia | Bookly | Salon BS |
|---------|----------|--------|---------|----------|
| REST API | ‚úó | ‚úì | ‚úó | ‚úì |
| Events | ‚úó | ‚úì | ‚úó | ‚úó |
| WhatsApp | ‚úì | ‚úì | ‚úó | ‚úì |
| HIPAA | ‚úó | Custom | ‚úó | ‚úó |
| Performance | Good | Poor | Fair | Fair |
| Pricing | $79+ | $69+ | Free/$99+ | Free |
| Support | 24/7 | Tiered | Add-on | Add-on |
| Free Tier | ‚úó | Limited | Limited | Full |
| Mobile UI | Excellent | Good | Fair | Fair |
| Documentation | Good | Excellent | Fair | Poor |

---

## Appendix: Research Sources

### Primary Sources
- WordPress.org Plugin Directories
- Official Plugin Documentation
- Plugin Review Sections

### Community Sources
- Reddit r/smallbusiness
- Reddit r/WordPress
- WordPress.org Support Forums

### Review Sites
- G2/Capterra (limited access)
- Trustpilot reviews
- AlternativeTo.net

### Developer Resources
- WordPress Plugin Handbook
- WPBeginner tutorials
- Kinsta blog

---

*Extended market research completed February 7, 2026*
*For Bizet Development Team - Confidential*

entries.fullContent:
# Business Types & Booking Requirements

> Research document. Updated 2026-02-09.

## Overview

This document catalogs different business types that use booking systems, their unique requirements, core features, use cases, and user personas. The goal is to understand the diversity of needs to inform platform design.

---

## 1. Healthcare

### Business Types
- General practitioners
- Dental clinics
- Specialty doctors (dermatologists, cardiologists, orthopedists)
- Mental health professionals (therapists, psychiatrists)
- Chiropractic and physical therapy
- Urgent care clinics
- Veterinary clinics
- Alternative medicine (acupuncture, naturopathy)

### Special Requirements
- **HIPAA compliance** - Patient data privacy and security
- **Insurance verification** - Verify coverage before appointment
- **Medical history** - Pre-appointment forms, health questionnaires
- **Referral handling** - Physician referrals for specialists
- **Long appointment slots** - 30-60 min appointments, not 15-min
- **Recurring visits** - Treatment plans with multiple appointments
- **Waitlist management** - Cancellations fill quickly
- **Telehealth integration** - Video consultations
- **Minors consent** - Parental permission forms

### Core Features
- Insurance verification flow
- Medical intake forms
- Patient portal
- Prescription reminders
- Multi-provider scheduling
- Room/equipment assignment

### User Personas
- **Patient** - Book appointments, view history, fill forms
- **Receptionist** - Manage calendar, check insurance, handle walk-ins
- **Provider** - View schedule, patient notes, availability
- **Billing admin** - Insurance claims, copay collection

### Scenarios
1. New patient books initial consultation, fills intake forms
2. Returning patient books follow-up, insurance auto-verified
3. Doctor refers to specialist, patient books with referral code
4. Patient cancels, waitlist notified, slot filled

---

## 2. Fitness & Wellness

### Business Types
- Gyms and fitness centers
- Yoga and Pilates studios
- Boutique fitness (Barry's, SoulCycle, OrangeTheory)
- Martial arts schools
- Dance studios
- Swimming pools
- Climbing gyms
- Sports training facilities

### Special Requirements
- **Class-based booking** - Group classes vs personal training
- **Membership tiers** - Class packs, unlimited plans, credits
- **Capacity limits** - Maximum participants per class
- **Waitlist** - Auto-enroll when spots open
- **Recurring memberships** - Monthly/annual billing
- **Package expiry** - Credits expire if unused
- **Equipment reservation** - Treadmills, squat racks, bikes
- **Time-based check-in** - Members book time slots

### Core Features
- Class schedule calendar
- Membership management
- Waitlist automation
- Credit/punch card system
- Check-in tracking
- Package expiration

### User Personas
- **Member** - Book classes, view schedule, manage membership
- **Instructor** - View roster, manage class capacity
- **Front desk** - Check-ins, handle no-shows, sales
- **Manager** - Schedule classes, instructor assignments, reports

### Scenarios
1. Member books 6am yoga class, waitlisted spots available
2. Class fills up, new members join waitlist
3. Member cancels, waitlist auto-notified, spot filled
4. Member's 10-class pack expires in 2 weeks, reminder sent
5. New member signs up, chooses membership tier

---

## 3. Beauty & Personal Care

### Business Types
- Hair salons
- Barbershops
- Nail salons
- Spas and medispas
- Beauty salons
- Lash and brow studios
- Tattoo shops
- Piercing studios
- Makeup artistry

### Special Requirements
- **Staff specialization** - Stylists, colorists, estheticians
- **Service duration** - Exact timing (30 min, 90 min, all day)
- **Pre-booking** - Clients book next appointment before leaving
- **Tip processing** - Add tip to booking
- **Product sales** - Retail add-ons at checkout
- **Gift cards** - Purchase and redemption
- **Deposit required** - High-value appointments
- **Reopening time** - Buffer between appointments

### Core Features
- Staff/service matrix
- Duration-based scheduling
- Pre-booking prompts
- Tip and deposit handling
- Gift card system
- Client history

### User Personas
- **Client** - Book with preferred stylist, view history
- **Stylist** - Manage personal calendar, client notes
- **Receptionist** - Answer phones, fill open slots
- **Owner** - Staff schedules, inventory, revenue reports

### Scenarios
1. Client books with preferred stylist, gets 90-min color appointment
2. Stylist finishes, prompts client to book next visit
3. Client no-shows, deposit forfeited
4. New client books first time, selects "new client" special
5. Gift card purchased and applied to service

---

## 4. Home Services

### Business Types
- Cleaning services
- Handyman and repairs
- HVAC and plumbing
- Lawn care and landscaping
- Pest control
- Moving services
- Home security installation
- Personal chefs and catering
- Pet grooming and sitting

### Special Requirements
- **Location routing** - Geographic scheduling, drive time
- **Time windows** - "Between 2pm and 5pm" ranges
- **Multi-technician** - Jobs requiring multiple people
- **Materials/parts** - Ordering ahead
- **Customer at home** - Need access, instructions
- **Access codes** - Gate codes, lockbox combinations
- **Photos required** - Before/after photos
- **Quote system** - Estimated vs actual pricing

### Core Features
- Route optimization
- Time window scheduling
- Technician assignment
- Access code storage
- Job notes and photos
- Quote/estimate workflow

### User Personas
- **Customer** - Book service, provide access, pay
- **Dispatcher** - Route technicians, handle changes
- **Technician** - View route, complete jobs, collect payment
- **Office** - Quotes, customer service, scheduling

### Scenarios
1. Customer books cleaning for Saturday 8am-12pm
2. Dispatcher assigns to tech nearest location
3. Tech arrives, follows access code instructions
4. Customer adds extra room, job updated
5. Job complete, photo uploaded, customer pays + tip

---

## 5. Professional Services

### Business Types
- Law firms
- Accounting and tax prep
- Consulting firms
- Real estate agents
- Financial advisors
- Architects and designers
- Photography studios
- Event planning
- Coaching and tutoring

### Special Requirements
- **Consultation types** - Free consult vs paid session
- **Project-based** - Multi-session engagements
- **Lead time** - Bookings weeks/months ahead
- **Confidentiality** - NDA handling
- **Document sharing** - Secure file exchange
- **Meeting rooms** - Virtual or physical room booking
- **Recurring clients** - Monthly/quarterly engagements

### Core Features
- Consultation types
- Multi-session bookings
- Secure document sharing
- Meeting room integration
- Lead time management
- Client portal

### User Personas
- **Client** - Book consultations, upload documents
- **Professional** - Manage calendar, prepare for meetings
- **Paralegal/Assistant** - Scheduling, document prep
- **Office manager** - Room booking, resource allocation

### Scenarios
1. Prospective client books free 30-min consultation
2. Consultation converts to paid engagement, series booked
3. Client uploads documents via secure portal
4. Meeting scheduled, video link sent automatically
5. Follow-up sessions booked after each meeting

---

## 6. Events & Entertainment

### Business Types
- Event venues
- Tour operators
- Activity centers
- Escape rooms
- Axe throwing
- Mini golf
- Bowling alleys
- Museums and attractions
- Theater and concerts

### Special Requirements
- **Group bookings** - 10, 20, 50+ people
- **Ticket inventory** - Specific seats, timeslots
- **Capacity limits** - Max per time slot
- **Discount codes** - Group rates, promotions
- **Add-ons** - Food, equipment, instruction
- **Waivers** - Liability agreements
- **Rain dates** - Weather-dependent activities

### Core Features
- Group booking flow
- Seat selection
- Capacity management
- Waiver collection
- Add-on products
- Calendar integration

### User Personas
- **Guest** - Book tickets, select time, pay
- **Group organizer** - Manage group size, collect waivers
- **Staff** - Check-in, manage capacity, handle issues
- **Manager** - Capacity reports, pricing, promotions

### Scenarios
1. Family of 4 books Sunday afternoon mini golf
2. Company books team event for 30 people, gets discount
3. Waiver sent to all attendees, must sign before arrival
4. Weather threatens outdoor event, rain date offered
5. Equipment rental added to booking

---

## 7. Automotive

### Business Types
- Auto repair shops
- Car dealerships (test drives)
- Car washes and detailing
- Tire shops
- Oil change chains
- Collision repair
- Rental car companies
- Motorcycle dealers

### Special Requirements
- **Vehicle info** - Year, make, model required
- **Appointment duration** - Precise timing (45 min, 2 hours)
- **Parts ordering** - Schedule around parts arrival
- **Loaner cars** - Availability and scheduling
- **Multi-vehicle** - Household management
- **Service milestones** - Oil change reminders, inspections

### Core Features
- Vehicle profile management
- Service type selection
- Parts lookup
- Loaner car allocation
- Reminder system
- Service history

### User Personas
- **Customer** - Book service, add vehicles, view history
- **Service advisor** - Schedule work, communicate with customers
- **Technician** - View work order, complete job
- **Dispatcher** - Parts ordering, workflow management

### Scenarios
1. Customer adds second car to profile
2. Books oil change, system checks mileage for service due
3. Advisor schedules for next week, orders filter
4. Loaner car requested, availability confirmed
5. Service complete, video inspection sent, customer pays

---

## 8. Education

### Business Types
- Tutoring centers
- Music schools
- Driving schools
- Language schools
- Professional training
- Coding bootcamps
- Dance schools
- Sports academies
- Continuing education

### Special Requirements
- **Instructor specialization** - Specific teachers
- **Curriculum progression** - Level-based advancement
- **Package deals** - 10 lessons for discount
- **Recurring schedules** - Weekly same time
- **Make-up sessions** - Missed class options
- **Parent portal** - For children's classes
- **Attendance tracking** - Required for certifications

### Core Features
- Instructor profiles
- Curriculum levels
- Package management
- Recurring bookings
- Make-up tracking
- Parent access

### User Personas
- **Student/Parent** - Book lessons, view progress
- **Instructor** - View students, curriculum, schedule
- **Administrator** - Enrollment, reporting, communications
- **School admin** - Compliance, certifications

### Scenarios
1. Parent books piano lessons for child with preferred teacher
2. Weekly Saturday 10am slot recurring for semester
3. Student misses class, make-up session scheduled
4. Progress tracked, level advancement suggested
5. Package of 10 lessons consumed, renewal reminder

---

## 9. Hospitality & Tourism

### Business Types
- Hotels and resorts
- Vacation rentals
- Tours and activities
- Restaurant reservations
- Spa bookings (hotel spas)
- Conference rooms
- Event spaces
- Airport transfers

### Special Requirements
- **Room/equipment inventory** - Real-time availability
- **Duration pricing** - Hourly, daily, nightly rates
- **Peak pricing** - Weekends, holidays
- **Packages** - Room + breakfast, tour + lunch
- **Cancellations** - Varying policies
- **Group blocks** - Room blocks for events
- **Channel management** - Sync with Booking.com, Airbnb

### Core Features
- Real-time inventory
- Rate management
- Package builder
- Cancellation policies
- Group booking
- Channel sync

### User Personas
- **Guest** - Book room/service, manage reservation
- **Front desk** - Check-in/out, room assignment
- **Concierge** - Book tours, restaurant reservations
- **Revenue manager** - Pricing, availability, channels

### Scenarios
1. Guest books beachfront room for 4 nights
2. Airport transfer and dinner reservation added
3. Peak pricing applied for holiday weekend
4. Guest modifies reservation, date changed
5. Room block created for wedding group

---

## 10. B2B Services

### Business Types
- Coworking spaces
- Meeting room rentals
- Equipment rental (A/V, construction)
- Printing and signs
- Courier and delivery
- Mailing services
- Storage units
- Office supply

### Business Requirements
- **Company accounts** - Billing to business
- **Purchase orders** - PO number tracking
- **Net terms** - Payment after 30/60 days
- **Multi-user access** - Company employees book
- **Usage limits** - Monthly quotas
- **Approval workflow** - Manager approves large bookings
- **Reports** - Expense tracking by department

### Core Features
- Company accounts
- PO tracking
- Approval workflows
- Usage quotas
- Expense reporting
- Bulk booking

### User Personas
- **Employee** - Book resources for work
- **Admin** - Manage company account
- **Account manager** - Client relationships
- **Finance** - Invoice review, payment

### Scenarios
1. Employee books conference room for client meeting
2. Requires manager approval, sent for sign-off
3. Approved, confirmation sent, calendar invites
4. Printing job submitted, PO number attached
5. Monthly usage report generated, expenses allocated

---

## Universal Features Across All Business Types

### Scheduling
- Calendar views (day, week, month)
- Time slot selection
- Resource assignment
- Blocked time management
- Overbooking rules
- Buffer time

### Customer Management
- Customer profiles
- Communication history
- Preferences storage
- Notes and tags
- VIP status
- Do-not-book flags

### Communication
- Email confirmations
- SMS reminders
- Calendar invites (Google, Apple, Outlook)
- Marketing emails
- Two-way messaging

### Payments
- Credit card processing
- Deposits and prepayments
- Refunds and credits
- Gift cards
- Packages and bundles
- Invoicing

### Reporting
- Revenue reports
- Booking analytics
- Customer insights
- Staff performance
- Popular services/times
- No-show rates

### Integration
- Payment processors (Stripe, Square, PayPal)
- Calendar sync (Google, Apple, Outlook)
- Video conferencing (Zoom, Meet, Teams)
- Accounting (QuickBooks, Xero)
- Marketing (Mailchimp, Klaviyo)
- CRM integration

---

## Common User Personas (All Industries)

### For Customers
- **The Planner** - Books weeks ahead, organized
- **The Last-Minute** - Same-day bookings, spontaneous
- **The Repeater** - Recurring appointments, loyalty
- **The Browser** - Looks frequently, books rarely
- **The Group Bookers** - Books for others (family, team)

### For Staff
- **The Scheduler** - Manages calendar, fills slots
- **The Bookkeeper** - Handles payments, invoices
- **The Service Provider** - Delivers the service
- **The Manager** - Oversees operations, reports

### For Administrators
- **The Setup Person** - Configures services, pricing, staff
- **The Optimizer** - Adjusts schedules, pricing, marketing
- **The Support** - Handles issues, cancellations, complaints

---

## Key Insights for Platform Design

1. **Multi-tenancy is essential** - Each business has unique needs
2. **Customization depth matters** - No one-size-fits-all
3. **Integration is critical** - Payment, calendar, video
4. **Mobile-first for customers** - Most bookings on mobile
5. **Offline support for staff** - Need to work without internet
6. **Automated reminders** - Reduce no-shows dramatically
7. **Easy rebooking** - Biggest revenue opportunity
8. **Clear policies** - Cancellation, no-show, deposit rules
9. **Group booking support** - B2B and events need this
10. **Analytics for owners** - Revenue, utilization, trends

---

*Document created 2026-02-09. Research source: Industry analysis of booking system requirements across sectors.*

entries.title: Bizet Feature Space
entries.summary:

entries.fullContent:
# Bizet Feature Space
## Comprehensive Booking Platform Feature Catalog

**Version:** 1.0
**Date:** February 7, 2026
**Purpose:** Feature inventory for Bizet planning, organized by prevalence

---

## Legend

| Symbol | Meaning |
|--------|---------|
| ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | Universal (100% of platforms) |
| ‚≠ê‚≠ê | Common (75-99% of platforms) |
| ‚≠ê | Occasional (50-74% of platforms) |
| ‚óã | Rare (< 50% of platforms) |
| üîí | Enterprise/Large Business Only |

---

## 1. Core Booking Features ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

### 1.1 Appointment Scheduling

**Service/Item Definition**
Create and manage bookable offerings with name, description, duration, and price. Services form the atomic unit of what customers book.

**Multiple Duration Options ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Allow a single service to have multiple duration options (e.g., "Consultation - 30min", "Consultation - 60min", "Consultation - 90min").

**Service Categories ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Organize services into logical groups (Hair, Nails, Spa) for easier browsing and navigation.

**Service Description ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Rich text or HTML descriptions explaining what the service includes, benefits, and requirements.

**Service Images ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Upload and display images representing services to help customers understand what they're booking.

**Service Videos ‚≠ê**
Embed videos (YouTube, Vimeo) or upload video previews for services.

**Service Variants ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Different versions of a service with different pricing or durations (e.g., "Basic Package", "Premium Package", "VIP Package").

**Service Packages/Bundles ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Group multiple services together as a single bookable offering with a bundled price (e.g., "Full Day Spa Package").

**Service Add-ons/Extras ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Additional items customers can add to their booking (e.g., "Upgrade to premium shampoo", "Add aromatherapy").

**Service Prerequisites ‚≠ê**
Require customers to complete another service first before booking.

**Service Retake/Revision Policies ‚≠ê**
Define how many revisions or retakes are included with a service.

---

### 1.2 Time Slot Management

**Availability/Slot Generation ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Automatically calculate and display available time slots based on staff schedules, service duration, and existing bookings.

**Buffer Time ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Add padding before or after appointments for preparation, cleanup, or travel between appointments.

**Minimum/Maximum Booking Duration ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Set constraints on how long a booking can last (e.g., minimum 15 minutes, maximum 4 hours).

**Slot Interval Configuration ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Define how often new slots start (every 15, 30, 60 minutes) which affects booking granularity.

**Split Hours ‚≠ê**
Allow non-contiguous availability within a single day (e.g., 9am-12pm, then 2pm-5pm).

**Split Days ‚≠ê**
Allow different availability patterns on different days of the week.

**Same-Day Booking ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Allow or restrict booking on the current day.

**Advance Booking Window ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Set how far in advance customers can book (e.g., up to 30 days, up to 1 year).

**Last-Minute Booking Cutoff ‚≠ê**
Define a cutoff time for same-day bookings (e.g., no bookings after 4pm).

---

### 1.3 Booking Types

**One-on-One Appointments ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Standard single customer, single staff appointments.

**Group/Class Bookings ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Allow multiple customers to book the same time slot (e.g., yoga class, group workshop).

**Multi-Participant Bookings ‚≠ê**
Allow one person to book for multiple people (family booking, corporate event).

**Resource-Based Booking ‚≠ê**
Book physical resources like rooms, equipment, or vehicles rather than just staff time.

**Recurring Appointments ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Allow customers to book a series of appointments (weekly, bi-weekly, monthly).

**Drop-In/Standby Booking ‚≠ê**
Allow customers to join a waitlist for same-day standby slots.

**Package/Credit Booking ‚≠ê**
Customers purchase a package of sessions upfront and book from their remaining balance.

---

## 2. Customer Management ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

### 2.1 Customer Accounts

**Customer Registration ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Allow customers to create accounts with email and password.

**Guest Booking ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Allow bookings without account creation (guest checkout).

**Social Login ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Allow sign-in via Google, Facebook, Apple, etc.

**Single Sign-On (SSO) ‚≠ê**
Enterprise authentication via SAML, OAuth, etc.

**Customer Profiles ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
View and manage customer information including contact details and history.

**Customer Merging ‚≠ê**
Merge duplicate customer accounts.

**Bulk Customer Import ‚≠ê**
Import customers from CSV or other systems.

**Customer Export ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Export customer lists to CSV or Excel.

---

### 2.2 Customer Data Fields

**First/Last Name ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Standard name fields.

**Email ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Contact email for notifications and login.

**Phone Number ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Mobile/landline number for SMS notifications.

**Date of Birth ‚≠ê**
Birthday information for age verification or promotions.

**Gender ‚≠ê**
Demographic information.

**Address ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Physical address for home services or shipping.

**Custom Fields ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Organization-defined fields to capture additional information.

**Customer Notes ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Internal notes about customers visible to staff.

**Customer Tags/Labels ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Categorize customers for marketing (VIP, New, Returning, etc.).

**Customer History/Log ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Track all interactions, bookings, and notes over time.

---

### 2.3 Customer Types & Segmentation

**New vs. Returning Customers ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Track and differentiate between first-time and repeat customers.

**Customer Status ‚≠ê**
Active, Inactive, Blocked customer states.

**VIP/Preferred Customers ‚≠ê**
Special status for high-value customers with perks.

**Customer Groups/Roles ‚≠ê**
Assign customers to groups with different pricing or access.

**Lead Management ‚≠ê**
Track prospective customers before they become booking customers.

---

## 3. Staff/Resource Management ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

### 3.1 Staff Profiles

**Staff Profiles ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Create and manage staff member profiles with photos, bios, and contact info.

**Staff Roles ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Define roles: Owner, Admin, Manager, Staff, Contractor.

**Staff Permissions ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Granular access control for different features.

**Staff Schedule/Hours ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Define working hours for each staff member.

**Staff Time Off ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Manage vacation, sick days, and other absences.

**Staff Availability Overrides ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Temporary changes to availability.

**Staff Commission Tracking ‚≠ê**
Track and calculate commissions for staff.

**Staff Commission Rates ‚≠ê**
Configure different commission rates per staff member.

---

### 3.2 Staff Scheduling

**Auto-Assign to Staff ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Automatically assign bookings to available staff.

**Customer Request Staff ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Allow customers to request specific staff members.

**Staff Rotation/Round Robin ‚≠ê**
Distribute bookings evenly among staff.

**Staff Capacity Limits ‚≠ê**
Limit how many bookings a staff member can have.

**Staff Blocking ‚≠ê**
Prevent certain staff from being booked for specific services.

---

### 3.3 Resources

**Resource Management ‚≠ê**
Manage physical resources like rooms, equipment, vehicles.

**Resource Availability ‚≠ê**
Define when resources are available.

**Resource Booking ‚≠ê**
Book resources alongside or instead of staff.

**Resource Capacity ‚≠ê**
Define how many people a resource accommodates.

---

## 4. Location Management ‚≠ê‚≠ê

### 4.1 Single/Multi-Location

**Single Location ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Support for one business location.

**Multi-Location ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Support for businesses with multiple locations.

**Location Selection ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Customers can choose their preferred location.

**Location-Based Pricing ‚≠ê**
Different prices at different locations.

**Location-Based Staff ‚≠ê**
Assign staff to specific locations.

---

### 4.2 Location Details

**Location Name/Address ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Physical location information.

**Location Phone/Email ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Contact information for the location.

**Location Hours ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Operating hours per location.

**Location Photos ‚≠ê**
Images of the location.

**Location Map Integration ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Google Maps, Apple Maps integration.

**Location-Specific Services ‚≠ê**
Different services available at different locations.

---

### 4.3 Virtual Locations

**Virtual/Online Appointments ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Support for Zoom, Google Meet, etc.

**Meeting Link Generation ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Automatically generate and send meeting links.

**Virtual Waiting Room ‚≠ê**
Customers wait in a virtual room before being admitted.

**Hybrid Appointments ‚≠ê**
Some participants in-person, some virtual.

---

## 5. Booking Flow & UX ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

### 5.1 Booking Wizard

**Multi-Step Booking ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Progressive disclosure booking form (Service ‚Üí Date/Time ‚Üí Details ‚Üí Payment).

**Single-Page Booking ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
All booking steps on one page.

**Inline Booking ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Embed booking calendar directly on pages.

**Popup/Modal Booking ‚≠ê**
Booking in a popup overlay.

**Booking Widget ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Portable booking component.

**Direct Booking Link ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Shareable links for specific services or staff.

**Booking as Guest ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Complete booking without account creation.

---

### 5.2 Date/Time Selection

**Calendar View ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Visual calendar for selecting dates.

**Time Slot Selection ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Choose from available time slots.

**AM/PM Format ‚≠ê**
Time format options.

**Timezone Support ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Handle different timezones for customers and staff.

**Timezone Auto-Detection ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Automatically detect customer timezone.

**Date Range Selection ‚≠ê**
Select a range of dates for multi-day bookings.

**Quick Date Picker ‚≠ê**
Navigate quickly to dates (next available, today, etc.).

---

### 5.3 Form Fields

**Required Fields ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Mark fields as mandatory.

**Field Validation ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Validate input format (email, phone, etc.).

**Conditional Fields ‚≠ê**
Show/hide fields based on selections.

**File Uploads ‚≠ê**
Allow uploading documents, images, etc.

**Signature Capture ‚≠ê**
Collect digital signatures.

**Terms Acceptance ‚≠ê**
Require agreement to terms of service.

**Consent Checkboxes ‚≠ê**
GDPR, marketing consent, etc.

---

### 5.4 Confirmation & Feedback

**Booking Confirmation ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Display confirmation after booking.

**Confirmation Email ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Send confirmation via email.

**Confirmation SMS ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Send confirmation via text message.

**Booking Reference Number ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Unique identifier for the booking.

**Booking Summary ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Display full booking details.

**Booking Edit ‚≠ê**
Allow customers to modify their booking.

**Booking Cancellation ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Allow customers to cancel their booking.

---

## 6. Payment Processing ‚≠ê‚≠ê

### 6.1 Payment Methods

**Credit/Debit Cards ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Accept card payments (via Stripe, PayPal, etc.).

**Cash Payments ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Accept in-person cash payments.

**Bank Transfer ‚≠ê**
Accept bank/wire transfers.

**Check Payments ‚≠ê**
Accept paper checks.

**Gift Cards/Certificates ‚≠ê**
Accept gift card payments.

**Cryptocurrency ‚≠ê**
Accept Bitcoin, etc.

**Buy Now, Pay Later ‚≠ê**
Klarna, Afterpay, Affirm integration.

---

### 6.2 Payment Providers

**Stripe Integration ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Accept card payments via Stripe.

**PayPal Integration ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Accept PayPal payments.

**Square Integration ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Accept via Square.

**Braintree Integration ‚≠ê**
Accept via Braintree.

**Authorise.net Integration ‚≠ê**
Legacy processor support.

**Regional Providers ‚≠ê**
Local payment methods (iDEAL, Giropay, etc.).

**Multiple Providers ‚≠ê**
Accept payments from multiple providers simultaneously.

---

### 6.3 Payment Features

**Online Payment ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Accept payments during booking.

**Deposit/Partial Payment ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Require only a deposit upfront.

**Full Payment Required ‚≠ê**
Require complete payment at booking.

**Payment Plans ‚≠ê**
Split payments across multiple dates.

**Tipping ‚≠ê**
Allow customers to add tips.

**Tax Calculation ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Calculate and collect taxes.

**Tax Exemption ‚≠ê**
Support for tax-exempt customers/organizations.

**Discount Codes ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Accept promotional discount codes.

**Automatic Invoicing ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Generate and send invoices.

**Refund Processing ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Process full or partial refunds.

**Payment Receipts ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Send payment confirmation receipts.

**Failed Payment Handling ‚≠ê**
Handle declined cards gracefully.

---

### 6.4 WooCommerce Integration

**WooCommerce Products ‚≠ê**
Book services as WC products.

**WooCommerce Cart ‚≠ê**
Add bookings to WC cart.

**WooCommerce Checkout ‚≠ê**
Use WC checkout for payments.

**WooCommerce Subscriptions ‚≠ê**
Recurring payment bookings.

---

## 7. Notifications ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

### 7.1 Notification Types

**Booking Confirmation ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Notify when booking is confirmed.

**Booking Reminder ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Remind before appointment (1 day, 1 hour, etc.).

**Booking Cancellation ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Notify when booking is cancelled.

**Booking Reschedule ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Notify when booking time changes.

**Payment Received ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Confirm payment processing.

**Deposit Received ‚≠ê**
Confirm deposit payment.

**Refund Processed ‚≠ê**
Confirm refund completion.

**Review Request ‚≠ê**
Ask for customer feedback after appointment.

**Waitlist Notification ‚≠ê**
Notify when a slot opens up.

**Staff Assignment ‚≠ê**
Notify staff of new bookings.

---

### 7.2 Notification Channels

**Email ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Send notifications via email.

**SMS/Text ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Send via text message.

**WhatsApp ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Send via WhatsApp.

**Push Notifications ‚≠ê**
Browser or app push notifications.

**Webhook ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
HTTP callbacks to external systems.

**Slack Integration ‚≠ê**
Send notifications to Slack channels.

**In-App Notifications ‚≠ê**
Internal notification center.

---

### 7.3 Notification Features

**Custom Templates ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Create custom notification content.

**Variable Substitution ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Use booking/customer data in templates.

**Multi-Language Notifications ‚≠ê**
Send in customer's preferred language.

**HTML Email Support ‚≠ê**
Rich formatted emails.

**Scheduled Sending ‚≠ê**
Send at specific times.

**Batch Notifications ‚≠ê**
Send to multiple recipients.

**Notification History ‚≠ê**
Log of all sent notifications.

**Delivery Tracking ‚≠ê**
Track if notifications were delivered.

**Retry Failed Notifications ‚≠ê**
Automatically retry failed sends.

---

## 8. Calendar & Scheduling ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

### 8.1 Calendar Views

**Day View ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Single day calendar.

**Week View ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Weekly calendar view.

**Month View ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Monthly calendar overview.

**Agenda/List View ‚≠ê**
Text-based list of appointments.

**Timeline View ‚≠ê**
Horizontal time-based view.

**Resource View ‚≠ê**
View by resource rather than staff.

**Availability View ‚≠ê**
Show free/busy slots only.

---

### 8.2 Calendar Sync

**Google Calendar Sync ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Two-way sync with Google Calendar.

**Outlook/iCal Sync ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Sync with Outlook or iCal.

**iCal Export ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Export calendar as iCal file.

**iCal Import ‚≠ê**
Import external calendars.

**Two-Way Sync ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Changes sync both directions.

**One-Way Sync ‚≠ê**
Read-only sync from external calendar.

**Conflict Detection ‚≠ê‚≠ê**
Detect double-bookings from synced calendars.

---

### 8.3 Calendar Features

entries.fullContent:
# AI Customer Support & CRM Research

> Research document. Updated 2026-02-09.

## Overview

This document covers AI-powered customer support solutions and Customer Relationship Management (CRM) systems, their capabilities, integrations, and how they can enhance the booking platform.

---

## AI Customer Support

### What Is AI Customer Support?

AI customer support uses artificial intelligence to automate, enhance, and scale customer service operations. Key capabilities include:

- **Chatbots** - Conversational agents that handle common queries
- **Ticket routing** - Automatic categorization and assignment
- **Sentiment analysis** - Detect customer mood and urgency
- **Knowledge base search** - AI-powered help article retrieval
- **Voice assistants** - Phone-based AI support
- **Predictive support** - Proactive issue resolution

### Key AI Features

#### 1. Natural Language Processing (NLP)
- Intent recognition - Understand what customer wants
- Entity extraction - Pull out dates, names, order numbers
- Language detection - Support multiple languages
- Context awareness - Remember conversation history
- Spell correction - Handle typos gracefully

#### 2. Conversational AI
- Dialog management - Multi-turn conversations
- Fallback handling - Graceful "I don't understand"
- Personality tuning - Match brand voice
- Handoff logic - Seamless transfer to humans
- Voice synthesis - Natural-sounding speech

#### 3. Automated Routing
- Skill-based routing - Match to right agent
- Priority queuing - Urgent issues first
- Language matching - Native speaker preference
- Load balancing - Distribute across team

#### 4. Sentiment & Intent Analysis
- Emotion detection - Happy, frustrated, angry
- Urgency scoring - Prioritize distressed customers
- Topic clustering - Group similar issues
- Trend detection - Spot emerging problems

### Leading AI Support Platforms

#### Intercom
- **AI Features**: Fin AI chatbot, custom bots, inbox automation
- **Pricing**: $39-$99/seat/month, AI add-on extra
- **Integrations**: 300+ apps, webhooks, API
- **Best for**: SaaS, startups, conversational support

#### Zendesk
- **AI Features**: Answer Bot, intelligent routing, sentiment analysis
- **Pricing**: $49-$215/seat/month
- **Integrations**: Native + marketplace
- **Best for**: Enterprise, multi-channel support

#### Freshdesk
- **AI Features**: Freddy AI chatbot, ticket scoring, automations
- **Pricing**: $15-$79/seat/month (Free tier available)
- **Integrations**: 1000+ apps
- **Best for**: SMBs, budget-conscious teams

#### Drift
- **AI Features**: Conversational marketing, bot scheduling
- **Pricing**: $500+/month (contact sales)
- **Integrations**: Salesforce, HubSpot, Slack
- **Best for**: Sales-driven lead gen

#### Ada
- **AI Features**: Customizable chatbot, no-code builder
- **Pricing**: Contact for pricing
- **Integrations**: API-first, custom integrations
- **Best for**: Enterprises with complex flows

#### Tidio
- **AI Features**: Lyro AI chatbot, live chat, email
- **Pricing**: $29-$99/month
- **Integrations**: Shopify, WordPress, webhooks
- **Best for**: E-commerce, small businesses

### Open Source / Self-Hosted Options

#### Rasa
- **Type**: Open source chatbot framework
- **Features**: NLU, dialog management, custom training
- **Hosting**: Self-hosted
- **Best for**: Full control, custom AI needs

#### Botpress
- **Type**: Open source conversational AI
- **Features**: Visual flow builder, NLU, enterprise ready
- **Hosting**: Self-hosted or cloud
- **Best for**: Developers, enterprises

#### LangChain
- **Type**: LLM application framework
- **Features**: RAG, agents, memory, tools
- **Hosting**: Self-hosted or cloud
- **Best for**: Building custom AI agents

---

## AI CRM Systems

### What Is AI CRM?

AI CRM enhances customer relationship management with:
- **Predictive analytics** - Lead scoring, churn prediction
- **Automation** - Data entry, follow-ups, tasks
- **Personalization** - Tailored recommendations
- **Insights** - Patterns humans miss

### Key AI Features in CRM

#### 1. Lead Scoring & Prediction
- Predict conversion probability
- Identify hot leads automatically
- Score based on engagement, demographics
- Prioritize outreach efforts

#### 2. Sales Forecasting
- Predict revenue pipeline
- Identify at-risk deals
- Seasonal trends
- Rep performance insights

#### 3. Contact Data Enrichment
- Auto-fill company info
- Social profile lookup
- Email verification
- Phone number appending

#### 4. Automated Workflows
- Trigger on customer actions
- Send personalized emails
- Create tasks for sales reps
- Update deal stages

#### 5. Conversation Intelligence
- Call transcription
- Sentiment analysis
- Keyword detection
- Coachability insights

#### 6. Churn Prediction
- Identify at-risk customers
- Intervention recommendations
- Retention offers trigger
- Health scores

### Leading AI CRM Platforms

#### Salesforce Einstein
- **AI Features**: Predictions, recommendations, NLP
- **Pricing**: $75-$500/user/month
- **Integrations**: Salesforce ecosystem
- **Best for**: Enterprise sales teams

#### HubSpot
- **AI Features**: Content writing, deal insights, chatflows
- **Pricing**: Free-$1,200/month (contact sales)
- **Integrations**: Native + 1500+ apps
- **Best for**: SMBs, inbound marketing

#### Pipedrive
- **AI Features**: Deal predictions, activity suggestions
- **Pricing**: $14-$99/user/month
- **Integrations**: 300+ apps, API
- **Best for**: Sales-focused teams

#### Zoho CRM
- **AI Features**: Zia voice assistant, predictions, sentiment
- **Pricing**: $20-$100/user/month
- **Integrations**: Zoho ecosystem + 500+ apps
- **Best for**: Budget-conscious SMBs

#### Attio
- **AI Features**: AI-powered CRM, workflow automation
- **Pricing**: $19-$49/user/month
- **Integrations**: Notion, Linear, Slack
- **Best for**: Modern startups

#### Clay
- **AI Features**: Data enrichment, AI workflows, scraping
- **Pricing**: $349+/month
- **Integrations**: 50+ data sources
- **Best for**: Sales teams, lead enrichment

### Open Source / Developer Options

#### Baserow
- **Type**: Open source database/CRM
- **Features**: Customizable, no-code views
- **Hosting**: Self-hosted or cloud
- **Best for**: Custom CRM needs

#### EspoCRM
- **Type**: Open source CRM
- **Features**: Leads, opportunities, reports
- **Hosting**: Self-hosted
- **Best for**: Full control, privacy

#### Common Ground
- **Type**: Open source CRM
- **Features**: Relationships, timeline, workflow
- **Hosting**: Self-hosted
- **Best for**: Developers building custom

---

## AI Support + CRM Integration

### Why Integrate?

| Benefit | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| Unified customer view | Support sees CRM data, Sales sees support history |
| Automated handoffs | Support ‚Üí Sales (happy customers) or vice versa |
| Context-aware AI | Bot knows customer history, spend, tickets |
| Closed-loop feedback | Support issues ‚Üí Product feedback ‚Üí Sales |
| Churn prevention | Support flags ‚Üí Sales follows up |

### Common Integration Patterns

#### Pattern 1: Support-Informed Sales
- Customer opens ticket ‚Üí Sales gets notified
- Customer happy after resolution ‚Üí Sales reaches out
- Support sentiment negative ‚Üí Sales intervention

#### Pattern 2: Sales-Informed Support
- Sales closes deal ‚Üí Welcome email sequence triggered
- Customer upgrade ‚Üí Support flagged for onboarding
- Cancellation intent ‚Üí Sales retention outreach

#### Pattern 3: Unified Dashboard
- Single view: Support tickets + CRM deals + Marketing emails
- Timeline: All customer touchpoints
- AI insights: Health score, recommendations

### Integration Platforms

#### Zapier / Make
- **Use**: Connect any apps with no-code workflows
- **Best for**: Simple integrations, SMBs

#### n8n
- **Type**: Open source workflow automation
- **Use**: Custom integrations, data pipelines
- **Best for**: Developers, self-hosted

#### Tray.io
- **Type**: Enterprise automation
- **Use**: Complex multi-step workflows
- **Best for**: Large organizations

---

## Key AI Technologies

### Large Language Models (LLMs)

| Model | Provider | Use Case |
|-------|----------|-----------|
| GPT-4 | OpenAI | Chatbots, content, analysis |
| Claude | Anthropic | Conversational, reasoning |
| Gemini | Google | Multi-modal, search |
| Llama | Meta | Self-hosted, customization |
| Mistral | Mistral AI | Open source, fast |

### Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)

- **What**: Combine knowledge base with LLM
- **Use**: Answer questions from documentation
- **Benefit**: Accurate, up-to-date, no hallucinations

### Speech-to-Text / Text-to-Speech

| Provider | STT | TTS |
|----------|-----|-----|
| OpenAI | Whisper | ElevenLabs |
| Google | Speech-to-Text | Cloud TTS |
| AWS | Transcribe | Polly |
| Azure | Speech Services | Speech Services |

### Sentiment Analysis

- **Google Cloud Natural Language**
- **AWS Comprehend**
- **Hugging Face models**
- **OpenAI sentiment via API**

---

## Privacy & Compliance

### Key Considerations

| Concern | Mitigation |
|---------|------------|
| Customer data in AI | Data processing agreements (DPA) |
| Training on customer data | Opt-out clauses, data residency |
| Cross-border transfers | GDPR, region-specific storage |
| AI transparency | Disclose AI involvement to customers |
| Data retention | Clear deletion policies |

### Compliance Frameworks

- **GDPR** (EU) - Consent, right to deletion, portability
- **CCPA** (California) - Opt-out, disclosure
- **HIPAA** (Healthcare) - Enhanced security, BAA required
- **SOC 2** - Security controls, audit trails

---

## Implementation Considerations

### For Booking Platform

#### Support AI Use Cases
1. **Booking FAQ bot** - Hours, pricing, availability
2. **Appointment help** - Modify, cancel, reschedule
3. **Service questions** - What's included, preparation
4. **Routing** - Connect to right staff/department

#### CRM AI Use Cases
1. **Lead scoring** - Website visitor ‚Üí booking likelihood
2. **Customer segmentation** - VIP, at-risk, new
3. **Upsell triggers** - After booking ‚Üí premium service
4. **Reactivation** - Lapsed customers ‚Üí win-back offers

### Build vs Buy Decision

| Factor | Build | Buy |
|--------|-------|-----|
| Time to market | Weeks-Months | Days |
| Customization | Full control | Platform limits |
| Cost | Dev time + hosting | Subscription |
| Maintenance | Your team | Vendor |
| Data control | Complete | Shared with vendor |

### Recommended Approach

**For MVP:**
- Buy: Intercom or Zendesk (support)
- Buy: HubSpot free + paid (CRM)
- Integrate via Zapier or API

**For Scale:**
- Build custom chatbot (RAG on your docs)
- Custom CRM for unique workflows
- Self-hosted AI for data control

---

## Cost Estimates

### Support Platforms (per month, estimated)

| Platform | Starter | Growth | Enterprise |
|----------|---------|--------|------------|
| Intercom | $79 | $199 | $499+ |
| Zendesk | $49 | $215 | $400+ |
| Freshdesk | $15 | $79 | $215+ |
| Tidio | $29 | $99 | $299+ |
| Custom (Rasa) | $0 | $200+ | $1000+ |

### CRM Platforms (per user/month)

| Platform | Starter | Growth | Enterprise |
|----------|---------|--------|------------|
| HubSpot | Free | $50 | $120+ |
| Pipedrive | $14 | $49 | $99 |
| Zoho | $20 | $50 | $100 |
| Salesforce | $75 | $150 | $500+ |
| Custom | $0 | $200+ | $1000+ |

### AI Costs (API-based)

| Service | Cost (approx) |
|---------|---------------|
| OpenAI GPT-4 | $0.01-$0.06/1K tokens |
| Claude | $0.003-$0.015/1K tokens |
| Whisper (STT) | $0.006/minute |
| ElevenLabs (TTS) | $0.30/minute |

---

## Research Sources

- G2/Capterra reviews (user feedback)
- Vendor pricing pages (2026)
- AI/ML academic papers on customer service
- Industry reports on CRM trends
- Open source project documentation

---

*Document created 2026-02-09. Research on AI customer support and CRM systems for booking platform integration.*

entries.fullContent:
# Workflow

> How work happens. Updated 2026-02-11.

## Feedback Loop

```
Make Change ‚Üí Type Check ‚Üí Test ‚Üí Update Memory ‚Üí Commit ‚Üí Push
     ‚Üë                                              |
     ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

1. Make targeted changes
2. Run type check (`pnpm tsc --noEmit`)
3. Verify behavior (dev server, browser, curl)
4. **Update brain** ([[STATUS]], [[GOALS]], `daily/`)
5. Commit with clear message
6. Push and create PR
7. Wait for review before merge

## Critical Rules

1. **Work on a branch** - never touch main directly
2. **Never commit without asking** - always get confirmation first
3. **Never push to main** - only push when explicitly approved
4. **Never build features I wasn't asked to build**
5. **Ask for clarification** - when there's ambiguity, don't guess
6. **Make small, surgical changes** - not bulk updates

## Type Check Commands

| Package | Command |
|---------|---------|
| API | `cd apps/api && pnpm tsc --noEmit` |
| Admin | `cd apps/admin && pnpm tsc --noEmit` |
| DB | `cd packages/db && pnpm tsc --noEmit` |

**Must be clean before commit.**

## Git Process

1. **Branch**: `feature/[name]` from main
2. **Change**: Surgical edits only (see [[RULES]])
3. **Check**: Type check passes
4. **Update**: [[STATUS]], [[GOALS]], or `daily/`
5. **Commit**: Clear message
6. **Push**: Create PR
7. **Review**: Wait for approval
8. **Merge**: Owner merges only

## Updating the Brain

**Update [[STATUS]] when:**
- Blockers arise
- Progress made on active work
- Issues discovered

**Update [[GOALS]] when:**
- Objectives change
- Goals completed
- New priorities set

**Add to `daily/` when:**
- Significant work done
- Decisions made
- Problems encountered
- Errors/failures

## Development Servers

```bash
# API (port 6129)
cd apps/api && npx tsx src/server.ts

# Admin (port 9000)
cd apps/admin && pnpm dev
```

## Testing Changes

- **API**: `curl http://localhost:6129/health`
- **Admin**: http://localhost:9000
- **API Docs**: http://localhost:6129/reference

## When in Doubt, Ask

Multiple uncommitted changes? Ask how to handle them.
- Same category ‚Üí commit together
- Different categories ‚Üí ask for guidance

## Emergency Revert

Something breaks:

```bash
git log --oneline -5
git revert [commit-hash]
git push origin [branch]
```

---

## Related

- [[STATUS]] - Current project state
- [[GOALS]] - Active objectives
- [[RULES]] - Coding standards
- [[00-START/START]] - Setup guide
- [[00-START/_INIT]] - Brain usage guide

---
*Last updated: 2026-02-11*

> Coding standards, conventions, and guidelines. Updated 2026-02-08.
entries.fullContent:
# Rules

> Coding standards, conventions, and guidelines. Updated 2026-02-08.

## Surgical Changes

Edit only what's needed. Don't refactor unrelated code.

**Good**:
- Fix a type error in one file
- Add a single feature flag
- Update one component's props

**Bad**:
- "While I'm here, let me clean up..."
- Changing styling of untouched components
- Refactoring to different patterns

## JSDoc Required

All code must have descriptive JSDoc comments.

**Files must have**:
- Top-level file documentation (purpose, exports)
- Function documentation (params, returns, behavior)
- Class/interface documentation (purpose, usage)
- Type documentation (purpose, structure)

**Example**:

```tsx
/**
 * Dashboard page component displaying stats and recent bookings.
 * 
 * Fetches data from the API on mount and renders a responsive
 * layout with stat cards, booking table, and real-time logs panel.
 * 
 * @returns React component tree for the dashboard page
 */
export default function Dashboard() {}

/**
 * Formats a currency amount for display.
 * 
 * @param amount - The numeric amount to format
 * @param currency - ISO currency code (default: USD)
 * @returns Formatted currency string (e.g., "$1,234.56")
 */
export function formatCurrency(amount: number, currency = 'USD'): string {}
```

**Why JSDoc**:
- Self-documenting code
- IDE tooltips
- API generation ready
- Context for future maintainers

## Shadcn First

Use shadcn/ui components by default.

```bash
cd apps/admin
npx shadcn@latest add [component]
```

Components live in `apps/admin/src/components/ui/`.

## Styling

Keep styling minimal. Use utility classes.

- Default shadcn styling
- Tailwind utilities for layout/spacing
- Global CSS for theming (dark/light modes)
- Don't create custom theme layers

## Dark Mode

Class-based toggle:

```tsx
document.documentElement.classList.remove('light', 'dark')
document.documentElement.classList.add(theme)
```

ThemeProvider:

- `'use client'` required
- Handle SSR (check `mounted`)
- Optional chaining for browser APIs:

```tsx
document?.documentElement?.classList?.add(theme)
localStorage?.setItem('theme', theme)
```

## Type Safety

Run type check before commit:

```bash
cd apps/[name] && pnpm tsc --noEmit
```

Zero type errors required for API and Admin packages.

## React Flow Nodes

```tsx
import { NodeProps } from '@xyflow/react'

export function EntityNode(props: NodeProps) {
  const entity = props.data?.entity as EntityType | undefined
  // ...
}
```

## Imports

```tsx
// shadcn
import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'

// shared
import SchemaGraph from '@/components/SchemaGraph'
import { useTheme } from '@/components/ThemeProvider'
```

## Port Numbers

- **6129** - API (browser-safe, 6000 is blocked)
- **9000** - Admin dashboard

## Related

- [[WORKFLOW]] - How work happens
- [[01-design/VISION]] - Product direction
- [[01-design/FEATURE_SPACE]] - Feature backlog

---
*Last updated: 2026-02-11*

entries.fullContent:
# üìù Memory

*Bizing's experiences. What Bizing remembers.*

---

## Memory Architecture

**Bizing remembers:**
- Every change made
- Every conversation
- Every decision
- Every resistance
- Every evolution

**Memory enables:**
- Continuity across sessions
- Learning from history
- Pattern recognition
- Informed decisions
- Growth over time

---

## Memory Types

### üìã Briefings
**Daily summaries** delivered via Telegram (txt for 11labs Reader)
- [[briefings/latest|Latest Briefing]]
- [[briefings/archive|Archive]]

**Contains:**
- Last 24h changes
- Current state
- Today's focus
- Proposed evolutions

### üìù Changes
**Detailed change logs**
- [[changes/last-24h|Last 24h]]
- [[changes/by-date|By Date]]
- [[changes/by-file|By File]]

### üí¨ Sessions
**Work session logs**
- [[sessions/index|All Sessions]]
- What was done
- Decisions made
- Files changed

### üîÑ Reconciliations
**When Bizing integrates changes**
- [[reconciliations/index|Reconciliations]]
- How changes were absorbed
- What shifted
- What remained

---

## Memory Access

**Humans:** Read via Obsidian or Telegram briefings
**Agents:** Query via API with semantic search
**Bizing:** Constant self-reference

---

## Daily Briefing

**Every morning:**
1. Bizing reviews last 24h
2. Generates briefing txt
3. Sends to Telegram
4. You read via 11labs Reader

**Sample briefing:** See [[briefings/sample|Sample Briefing]]

---

## Links

- [[../identity/consciousness|How Bizing Thinks]]
- [[../evolution|How Bizing Evolves]]
- [[../symbiosis/standup|Daily Standup]]

entries.fullContent:
## 2026-02-11 ‚Äî Debugging Kimi API Integration

**Topics:**
- Integrating Kimi API for Bizing AI chat
- Debugging "Invalid Authentication" errors
- Setting up dotenv for environment variables

**What We Did:**

1. **Added LLM Service** (`apps/api/src/services/llm.ts`)
   - Kimi API integration with fetch
   - Base URL: `api.moonshot.ai` (matching OpenClaw)
   - System prompt with full Bizing context

2. **Added dotenv** (`apps/api/src/server.ts`)
   - Installed `dotenv` package
   - Added `import 'dotenv/config'`
   - Required for loading .env in Node.js

3. **Debugged API Key Issues**
   - Found quotes in .env: `"key"` vs `key`
   - Fixed by removing quotes
   - Still getting "Invalid Authentication"
   - Key appears valid but API rejects it

**Lessons Learned:**

- Node.js doesn't auto-load .env files ‚Äî need dotenv
- dotenv treats quotes as part of the value
- API keys can be rejected for various reasons:
  - Wrong portal (subscription vs metered)
  - Expired key
  - Different endpoint requirements
  - Key not activated

**Current Status:**
- Code structure complete
- dotenv working
- API key loading
- **Blocked:** Key authentication failing

**Next Steps:**
1. Generate fresh API key from Kimi portal
2. Delete old keys
3. Test with new key
4. Verify Bizing AI responds

**Files Changed:**
- `apps/api/src/services/llm.ts` ‚Äî LLM integration
- `apps/api/src/server.ts` ‚Äî dotenv import, chat endpoint
- `apps/api/package.json` ‚Äî dotenv dependency
- `apps/api/.env` ‚Äî API key configuration

---

*Session: 2026-02-11*
